blocks.text: This is a front-end system design question about a TikTok-style short-video feed. The interviewer wants to see how you keep playback fast, scrolling smooth, and memory bounded while millions of users watch videos simultaneously.

blocks.title: Use RADIO
blocks.text: **R**eflect (restate the UX goal), **A**ssumptions (traffic, devices, networks), **D**ecide (architecture + caching), **I**mplement (frontend plan), **O**utcome (metrics + rollout).

**What you are solving:**
An endless short-video feed with fast first play, preloading, and smooth scrolling. The UI must adapt to slow networks and avoid memory leaks over long sessions.

**What the interviewer is testing:**
- Fast first play and prefetch strategy
- Handling variable networks and devices
- Virtualization and memory control
- Caching and CDN awareness
- UI performance budgets and observability

steps.title: 1) Reflect
steps.text: Define the UX: instant playback, smooth scroll, consistent controls.

steps.title: 2) Assumptions
steps.text: Traffic, device mix, bandwidth, and acceptable startup latency.

steps.title: 3) Decide
steps.text: Pick preloading strategy, caching layers, virtualization, and error handling.

steps.title: 4) Implement
steps.text: Explain component structure, data flow, and render pipeline.

steps.title: 5) Outcome
steps.text: Define success metrics: time-to-first-frame, dropped frames, error rate.

blocks.title: Clarifying questions
items: How many videos should be preloaded?
Should videos autoplay on cellular by default?

blocks.title: Non-functional expectations
items: Stable 60 FPS scroll on mid-range devices.
Bounded memory usage over long sessions.
Consistent UI across regions and devices.
